div.h2: Welcome to Fremont RE-2 School District

div.div:
Fremont RE-2 School District is a consolidated and joint school district. The district serves the communities of Williamsburg, Rockvale, Coal Creek, Penrose, and Wetmore. Florence is the home of the district's administration offices, Fremont Elementary School, Fremont Middle School, and Florence High School, newly built in 2006. Penrose is home to a K-5 elementary school built in 2005.
Florence is located in close proximity to Canon City, Pueblo and Colorado Springs, and a two-hour drive from Denver.
The Plains and Pueblo Reservoir lie about 20 minutes east of Florence. The area is indeed blessed with great diversity in geography, enterprise and culture. The city of Florence has become a mecca for antique dealers and shoppers. Penrose is rich in agricultural produce, especially apple orchards, and Wetmore is a fertile ranching community
The Climate in the area of the Arkansas Valley has been known as the "Banana Belt". Winters are generally mild and summers are warm but comfortable. Fremont County
is a great place to live and enjoy.

h3.span:
INFORMATION FOR FREMONT RE-2 SCHOOL
DISTRICT EMERGENCY FEEDING PROGRAM
Fremont Re-2 School District will distribute meals on Tuesday April 21.
On Tuesday, April 21 any child 18 years old and under will be able to pick up a meal package consisting of 4 breakfasts and 4 lunches. Next week we will only distribute meals one time at the following locations and time:
Tuesday, April 21
Fremont Elementary 10:30-12:00
Penrose Elementary 1:00-2:30
FJSHS 3:30-5:00
Butter Braids will be distributed during the FJSHS designated timeframe.
___________________________________________
DISTRICT BIDDING

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 20pt; font-family: "Baskerville Old Face", serif;

p.span: The following vehicles are being offered for sale by Fremont School District RE-2.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; white-space: pre; font-family: "Baskerville Old Face", serif;
font-size: 22pt; text-align: center; font-family: "Baskerville Old Face", serif;

li.span: 2002, Ford E150 XLT Club Wagon van, 12 passenger, automatic transmission, 5.4 liter gas engine. 232,184 miles
1993, Dodge Ram 250 truck, 5.9 liter gas engine, 3 passenger. 130,888 miles
Bidding will close at noon, Monday, March 23, 2020.
Payment will be by cash or certified check.
Vehicles are being sold “AS IS” with no implied warranty or guarantee.
If you are awarded the bid, the vehicle must be paid for and picked up by 4:00, March 31, 2020.

p.span: These vehicles may be viewed and any questions will be answered by contacting Dave Mercado at 784-6712, extension 2544.
Winning bid will be contacted by phone. (Please include your phone number somewhere on your bid.
Bids must be sealed and hand carried to:

div.p:
Fremont RE-2 Returning Student Registration and Kindergarten Round-up is open April 1st, 2020.
1. Please use the Parent Portal to complete the returning student registration
2. Information required for Kindergarten:
a. Completed On-line Registration (under the Parents Tab)
b. Kindergarten Immunization Record
c. Official Birth Certificate
d. Parent Photo ID
e. Proof of Residency (i.e. Utility Bills, Lease Agreements)
Please contact Registration@re-2.org for assistance

span.style: font-size: 9pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: Fremont RE-2 School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, marital status, national origin, religion, ancestry, age, disability, need for special education services, genetic information, pregnancy or childbirth status, or other status protected by law in admission, access to, treatment or employment in its educational programs or activities. Additionally, a lack of English language skills is not a barrier to admission or participation in activities. The following individuals have been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies: Dr. Brenda Krage, Superintendent,and EEO/Affirmative Action/Title IX/Section 504 Compliance Officer for complaints involving employees, and Jason Cellan, Title IX Compliance Officer for complaints involving students. Both individuals can be located at 403 W. 5th Street, Florence, Colorado, 81226. (719) 784-6312. Complaint procedures have been established for students, parents, employees, and members of the public. (

strong.span: What do you want us to know?

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center;

span.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 24px; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);

strong.span:
We know it can be hard as a working parent to have to worry about making sure your kids stay busy and not in fear during quarantine. Our team created a guide to help with addressing kid questions and how to protect your home and property during this pandemic.
https://www.reviews.com/health-wellness/medical-alerts/protect-home-and-family-during-covid-19-crisis/
We all need to make sure during the stay-at-home order we are safe and prepared. The article we created is here to take the weight off your shoulders by including:
Tips on how to protect your kids and property while at home
Ways to reduce in-home exposure risks to COVID-19 and create a safe environment during stay-at-home orders
A downloadable PDF to help parents easily streamline all emergency contact information for their children
_________________________________________
SCHOOL CLOSURE UPDATE 04.01.20
Today, Governor Polis extended the Executive Order specific to closing schools by suspending in-person learning from April 17 to April 30 or until further modified. The April 30th date aligns with the National Social Distancing guidelines put forth by the Federal Government.
School closures are a key part of the social distancing strategy that officials hope will slow the spread of the COVID-19 virus.
Hang in there, Fremont Re-2! We can do this!
Take good care, Dr. Brenda Krage, Superintendent _______________________________________
COVID-19 School Support
COVID-19 (Spanish) Apoyo para las escuelas
_______________________________________
IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR FAMILIES
School Closure Guidance for Fremont Re-2 Families
_______________________________________
Governor Order to Extend School Closures

All Fremont Re-2 School Facilities
will be Closed until April 17

p.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; border: none; text-align: left;
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: left;
p.span: To help mitigate the spread of the COVID-19 virus in Colorado, on Wednesday, March 18, 2020, Colorado Governor Jared Polis ordered that all public and private schools across the state suspend in-person learning from March 23 to April 17.

p.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: left;

div.p: The executive order directs Colorado school districts and the Charter School Institute to make every effort to provide alternative learning opportunities during this time while taking into account the needs of local communities. This order also directs the Commissioner of Education to issue guidance to support P-12 school systems in developing and implementing plans to assist families and students in accessing alternative learning, providing free and reduced lunch and breakfast, and offering waivers for instructional time as appropriate.

p.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: left;

div.p: “Protecting the health of all Coloradoans is our top priority, and moving to online learning and other ways to support learning at home is absolutely the right thing to do,” said Education Commissioner Katy Anthes. “We know school leaders, educators and families will have a lot of questions about how to support their students’ learning at home during this unprecedented time. The department is working on guidance and developing resources to support our schools and students, and it will be available very soon.”

p.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: left;

div.p: The Governor made this order via press release this evening. Read it online here: https://www.colorado.gov/governor/news/colorado-takes-further-action-address-public-health-threat-covid-19. Fremont Re-2 along with many surrounding districts in the region had already decided to close school buildings through March 27. This order will extend that timeframe. At this time, and per this order, students will return to school on Monday, April 20 unless otherwise notified.

p.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: left;

div.p: While the executive order provides local districts flexibility, it also presents great challenges in how we assist families and students in accessing alternative learning. I appreciate the Governor’s guidance and leadership during this challenging time. I am talking daily with surrounding district leaders and our local leaders to determine how we best move forward. In the coming days I will provide our community with more specifics.

p.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: left;

div.p: This is a new reality for all and it will require all of us working together in support of our children. I know that this information brings both certainty and uncertainty for the weeks ahead. I am asking that we allow each other a measure of grace, as we develop plans for what school looks like in the weeks ahead. Now, more than ever, we must work together for the benefit of our children and our community. I thank you for being patient as we navigate this new reality.

p.style: background: rgb(254, 254, 254); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; border: none; text-align: left;
p.span: Take good care! Dr. Brenda Krage, Superintendent

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

strong.span: ​How to Talk with Children about the Coronavirus

p.style: font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; border: none; text-align: center;

strong.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

strong.strong: What you need to know about 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

strong.div: We are aware the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention released a statement this week advising communities to prepare for potential outbreak of COVID-19, commonly known as the coronavirus. It is normal to be concerned about new diseases. We are all learning more about the Coronavirus as the information is being released frequently. The best thing is to stay informed from reliable sources of information and know the facts.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

strong.div: Fremont Re-2 has an up-to-date Emergency Response Crisis Plan that includes measures to address communicable diseases and we are monitoring the Coronavirus closely. You can also do directly the the Centers for Disease Control at https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/about/index.html to access information.

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
